member.name: T:SharpHsql.Access
member.summary: Access Class. The collection (ArrayList) of User object instances within a specific database. Methods are provided for creating, modifying and deleting users, as well as manipulating their access rights to the database objects.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Access.#ctor
member.summary: Access Class constructor. Creates a new ArrayList to contain the User object instances, as well as creating an initial PUBLIC user, with no password.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Access.GetRight(System.String)
member.summary: GetRight method declaration. This GetRight method takes a string argument of the name of the access right.
member.param: A string representation of the right.
member.returns: A static int representing the string right passed in.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Access.GetRight(SharpHsql.AccessType)
member.summary: GetRight method declaration. This GetRight method takes a int argument of the access right.
member.param: A static int representing the right passed in
member.returns: A string representation of the right or rights associated with the argument.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Access.CreateUser(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: CreateUser method declaration. This method is used to create a new user. The collection of users is first checked for a duplicate name, and an exception will be thrown if a user of the same name already exists.
member.param: Is this a database admin user?
member.returns: An instance of the newly created User object

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Access.DropUser(System.String)
member.summary: DropUser method declaration. This method is used to drop a user. Since we are using a vector to hold the User objects, we must iterate through the ArrayList looking for the name. The user object is currently set to null, and all access rights revoked.
member.remarks: An ACCESS_IS_DENIED exception will be thrown if an attempt is made to drop the PUBLIC user.
member.param: name of the user to be dropped

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Access.GetUser(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: GetUser method declaration. This method is used to return an instance of a particular User object, given the user name and password.
member.remarks: An ACCESS_IS_DENIED exception will be thrown if an attempt is made to get the PUBLIC user.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Access.GetUsers
member.summary: GetUsers method declaration. This method is used to access the entire ArrayList of User objects for this database.
member.returns: The ArrayList of our User objects

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Access.Grant(System.String,System.String,SharpHsql.AccessType)
member.summary: Grant method declaration. This method is used to grant a user rights to database objects.
member.param: right to grant to the user

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Access.Revoke(System.String,System.String,SharpHsql.AccessType)
member.summary: Revoke method declaration. This method is used to revoke a user's rights to database objects.
member.param: right to grant to the user

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Access.Get(System.String)
member.summary: This private method is used to access the User objects in the collection and perform operations on them.

member.name: T:SharpHsql.ByteArray
member.summary: ByteArray class declaration. This class allows HSQL to store binary data as an array of bytes. It contains methods to create and access the data, perform comparisons, etc.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.ByteArray.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: ByteArray Constructor declaration. Converts a string parameter to the array of bytes the ByteArray object will contain.
member.param: The byte array Base64 string representation.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.ByteArray.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: ByteArray Constructor declaration. Creates a ByteArray object from an array of bytes.

member.name: P:SharpHsql.ByteArray.Value
member.summary: Value method declaration. Give access to the object's data.
member.remarks: The array of bytes representing this objects data.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.ByteArray.CompareTo(SharpHsql.ByteArray)
member.summary: CompareTo method declaration. This method compares the object to another ByteArray object.
member.param: ByteArray object we are comparing against.
member.returns: Zero if objects are the same, non-zero otherwise.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.ByteArray.Serialize(System.Object)
member.summary: Serialize method declaration. This method serializes an object into an array of bytes.
member.returns: A static byte array representing the passed object

member.name: M:SharpHsql.ByteArray.SerializeTostring(System.Object)
member.summary: SerializeTostring method declaration. This method serializes an object into a string.
member.returns: A string representing the passed object

member.name: M:SharpHsql.ByteArray.Deserialize
member.summary: Deserialize method declaration. This method returns the array of bytes stored in the instance of ByteArray class as an object instance.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.ByteArray.Deserialize(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Deserialize method declaration. This method returns the array of bytes stored in the instance of ByteArray class as an object instance.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.ByteArray.CreateString(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Createstring method declaration. This method creates a string from the passed array of bytes.
member.returns: A Base64 string representation of the byte array.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.ByteArray.ToString
member.summary: ToString method declaration. This method creates a string from the passed array of bytes stored in this instance of the ByteArray class.
member.returns: The string representation of the ByteArray.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.ByteArray.GetHashCode
member.summary: GetHashCode method declaration. This method returns the hashcode for the data stored in this instance of the ByteArray class.

member.name: T:SharpHsql.Cache
member.summary: Cache class declaration. The cache class implements the handling of cached tables.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Cache.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Cache constructor declaration. The cache constructor sets up the initial parameters of the cache object, setting the name used for the file, etc.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Cache.Open(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Open method declaration. The open method creates or opens a database file.
member.param: Flag that indicates if this cache is readonly

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Cache.Flush
member.summary: Flush method declaration. The flush method saves all cached data to the file, saves the free position and closes the file.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Cache.Shutdown
member.summary: Shutdown method declaration. The shutdown method closes the cache file. It does not flush pending writes.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Cache.Free(SharpHsql.Row,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Free method declaration. This method marks space in the database file as free.
member.remarks: If more than MAX_FREE_COUNT free positios then they are probably all are too small anyway; so we start a new list. TODO: This is wrong when deleting lots of records.
member.param: Row object to be marked free
Offset in the file this Row was stored at
Size of the Row object to free

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Cache.Add(SharpHsql.Row)
member.summary: Add method declaration. This method adds a Row to the Cache. It walks the list of CacheFree objects to see if there is available space to store the new Row, reusing space if it exists, otherwise we grow the file.
member.param: Row to be added to Cache

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Cache.GetRow(System.Int32,SharpHsql.Table)
member.summary: GetRow method declaration. This method reads a Row object from the cache.
member.param: Offset of the requested Row in the cache
member.returns: The Row object as read from the cache.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Cache.CleanUp
member.summary: CleanUp method declaration. This method cleans up the cache when it grows too large. It works by checking Rows in held in the Cache's iLastAccess member and removing Rows that haven't been accessed in the longest time.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Cache.Remove(SharpHsql.Row)
member.summary: Remove method declaration. This method is used to remove Rows from the Cache. It is called by the CleanUp method.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Cache.GetWorst
member.summary: GetWorst method declaration. This method finds the Row with the smallest (oldest) iLastAccess member. Called by the Cleanup method.

member.name: T:SharpHsql.CacheFree
member.summary: CacheFree Class declaration. This class is essentially an object used to create a singly linked list of the free space available in a HSQL database file.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Library.Abs(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the absolute value of the given double value.
member.param: The number for which to determine the absolute value.
member.returns: The absolute value of d, as a double.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Library.Trim(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the character sequence s, with the leading, trailing or both the leading and trailing occurences of the first character of the character sequence trimstr removed.
member.param: The character whose occurences will be removed.
member.returns: Source, with the leading, trailing or both the leading and trailing occurences of the first character of trimstr removed.
member.remarks:
This method is in support of the standard SQL String function TRIM. Ordinarily, the functionality of this method is accessed from SQL using the following syntax:
* <trim function> ::= TRIM <left paren> <trim operands> <right paren> <trim operands> ::= [ [ <trim specification> ] [ <trim character> ] FROM ] <trim source> <trim source> ::= <character value expression> <trim specification> ::= LEADING | TRAILING | BOTH <trim character> ::= <character value expression>
(since HSQLDB 1.7.2)

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Library.Datediff(System.String,System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Returns the number of units elapsed between two dates. Contributed by Michael Landon
member.param: Specifies the unit in which the interval is to be measured.
The starting datetime value for the interval. This value is subtracted from d2 to return the number of date-parts between the two arguments.
The ending datetime for the interval. d1 is subtracted from this value to return the number of date-parts between the two arguments.

member.name: T:SharpHsql.EventLogHelper
member.summary: Provides static methods that supply helper utilities for event log data access. This class cannot be inherited.
member.remarks: A more general logger class is used by applications to log messages
member.author: Andrs G Vettori

member.name: M:SharpHsql.EventLogHelper.WriteLogEntry(System.String)
member.summary: Writes an entry in the event log.
member.param: The string to write to the event log.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.EventLogHelper.WriteLogEntry(System.String,System.Diagnostics.EventLogEntryType)
member.summary: Writes an entry in the event log.
member.param: The string to write to the event log.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.EventLogHelper.WriteLogEntry(System.String,System.Diagnostics.EventLogEntryType,System.String)
member.summary: Writes an entry in the event log.
member.param: The string to write to the event log.
The source by which the application is registered on the specified computer.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.EventLogHelper.WriteLogEntry(System.String,System.Diagnostics.EventLogEntryType,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Writes an entry in the event log.
member.param: The string to write to the event log.
The source by which the application is registered on the specified computer.

The name of the log the source's entries are written to. Possible values include: Application, Security, System, or a custom event log. If you do not specify a value, the logName defaults to Application.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.EventLogHelper.WriteLogEntry(System.String,System.Diagnostics.EventLogEntryType,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes an entry in the event log.
member.param: The string to write to the event log.
The source by which the application is registered on the specified computer.

The name of the log the source's entries are written to. Possible values include: Application, Security, System, or a custom event log. If you do not specify a value, the logtype defaults to Application.
The application-specific identifier for the event.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.EventLogHelper.RemoveLogType(System.String)
member.summary: Removes an event log from the local computer.
member.param: The name of the log the source's entries are written to. Possible values include: Application, Security, System, or a custom event log. If you do not specify a value, the logName defaults to Application.

member.summary: Removes an event log from the local computer.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.EventLogHelper.RemoveEventSource(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the event source registration from the event log of the local computer.

member.name: T:SharpHsql.LogEntryType
member.summary: Specifies the event type of an log entry.
member.remarks: The type of an log entry is used to indicate the severity of a log entry. Each log must be of a single type, which the application indicates when it reports the log.

member.name: F:SharpHsql.LogEntryType.Audit
member.summary: An audit log. This indicates a successful audit.

member.name: F:SharpHsql.LogEntryType.Debug
member.summary: A debug log. This is for testing and debugging operations.

member.name: F:SharpHsql.LogEntryType.Information
member.summary: An information log. This indicates a significant, successful operation.

member.name: F:SharpHsql.LogEntryType.Warning
member.summary: A warning log. This indicates a problem that is not immediately significant, but that may signify conditions that could cause future problems.

member.name: F:SharpHsql.LogEntryType.Error
F:SharpHsql.LogEntryType.Fatal

member.name: T:SharpHsql.Log
member.summary: This class is responsible for most file handling.
member.remarks:
A HSQL database consists of a .properties file, a .script file (contains a SQL script), a .data file (contains data of cached tables) and a .backup file (contains the compressed .data file).
This is an example of the .properties file. The version and the modified properties are automatically created by the database and should not be changed manually.
The other properties are optional, this means they are not created automatically by the database, but they are interpreted if they exist in the .script file. They have to be created manually if required. If they don't exist the default is used.
This are the defaults for the database 'mytest':
<?xml version="1.0"?> <!--SharpHSQL Configuration--> <?Instruction Configuration Record?> <Properties LogFile="mytest.log" DataFile="mytest.data" Backup="mytest.backup" Version="1.0.0.0" ReadOnly="false" Modified="no" />

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Log.Checkpoint
member.summary: Performs a checkpoint operation on the database.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Log.Write(SharpHsql.Channel,System.String)
member.summary: Writes a SQL statement to the transaction log.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Log.ScriptToFile(SharpHsql.Database,System.String,System.Boolean,SharpHsql.Channel)
member.summary: Script the database objects to a file.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Log.RenameNewToCurrent(System.String)
member.summary: Renames a .new files to be the current database files.

member.name: M:SharpHsql.Parser.ProcessAlter
member.remarks: The only change I've made to Sergio's original code was changing the insert's to call insertNoCheck to bypass the trigger mechanism that is a part of hsqldb 1.60 and beyond. - Mark Tutt
